cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 60 mi SW of Ponce, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest across Hispaniola and Cuba, then turning northwest into the central Gulf of Mexico and toward the northwest Gulf Coast (TX/LA area).
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northwest Gulf Coast near the Texas-Louisiana border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Central Bahamas; Cuban provinces of Las Tunas, Holguin, Guantanamo, Santiago de Cuba, and Granma
weather_observation.warning_coast: Puerto Rico, U.S. Virgin Islands, northern & southern coasts of the Dominican Republic, northern coast of Haiti, southeastern Bahamas, Turks and Caicos Islands
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greater Antilles, Bahamas, and the U.S. Gulf Coast from Texas to Alabama within 5 days
weather_observation.wind: Low (13%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds (34 kt) at the port late Wed–Thu; strongest potential winds 35–45 mph if the center tracks nearer to the Upper Texas coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If Laura tracks west of forecast, minor to moderate surge (3 ft+) could occur along Galveston Bay and the Houston Ship Channel; current outlook keeps risk low but not negligible.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands could bring 2–4+ inches with locally higher totals if the core passes near or east of the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas and long-period swells in the Gulf beginning mid-week may disrupt vessel scheduling and cargo operations.
